channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bed mattress blocking fire exit, 3rd July
item.description:
There is a dirty single bed mattress obstructing the Library fire exit and in the way on the pavement for pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erith High Street, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime and human forest outside optician dorset street side and outside 64 baker street, 3rd July
item.description:
Lime and human forest bikes blocking pavement and parking stand need to clear out from pavement outside 68 Baker street and also side of optician on Dorset street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 70, Baker Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amount of rubbish including drink cans and bags of dog poo dumped on busy pavement where kids walk to school, 3rd July
item.description:
This appeared very recently spread over the pavement and is unhygenic and unpleasant particularly in the very hot weather when children are walking to school. The dirty papers and bags are blowing across the area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wyndcliff Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: You’ve marked this fly tipping as fixed and it’s not, 3rd July
item.description:
Reported this yesterday, was told it’s fixed, yet I’ve just walked past the same pile again today

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brook Drive, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish on Marne Street, 3rd July
item.description:
There has been rubbish, including old furniture left near the tree outside 58-56 Marne Street for a few days and is now spilling onto the road attracting wildlife.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Marne Street, Kensal Town, London

item.title: St. Martin's Lane junction with William IV Street - plastic traffic bollard laying on the carriageway. Damaged and off the ground fixtures. I have picked the bollard up from the road and placed it on the highway for pick up by contractors FM Conway’s. Thanks., 3rd July
item.description:
St. Martin's Lane junction with William IV Street - plastic traffic bollard laying on the carriageway. Damaged and off the ground fixtures. I have picked the bollard up from the road and placed it on the highway for pick up by contractors FM Conway’s. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Saint Martin's Lane, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Faulty drain cover that makes clanging noise as vehicles drive over them, 3rd July
item.description:
This noise has been on both sides of the road. It seem like a remedial repair has been done at the Bloomsbury Avenue side of the road as the noise though not totally eliminated, it has drastically reduced. Now across the road, Orchard Avenue side, the drain cover on Avenue Road are making disturbing sounds as vehicles drive over them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Orchard Avenue, Southgate, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Road drain/gully cover - missing or damaged

item.title: One metre pot hole, 3rd July
item.description:
The pot hole has been there for months, right by the traffic lights and in line with my tyres. As you turn left from Brampton Rd into Crooklog Rd towards Bexleyheath.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crook Log, Welling, London

item.title: Furniture parts and builders’ scrap, 3rd July
item.description:
Blocking pavement for pedestrians

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alberta Street, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead birds caught in balcony netting, 3rd July
item.description:
For over 2 months these birds have been caught in the netting on a balcony for a house adjacent to ours - we believe the house may be unoccupied as there's been no movement or lights on ever to indicate someone is there and could deal with the issue. It's a disturbing sight to see, as well as a hazard for other birds that we've seen who keep flying through the net somehow and struggle to get out, please removing the netting and dispose of the animals bodies caught on the balcony.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Estate Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Priory park road, 3rd July
item.description:
Blue bags left on pavement for more than a week. These have been shredded by foxes and rubbish has been spread throughout the street.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Priory Park Road, London

item.category: Street cleaning - Blue bags left on street

item.description:

item.title: Loudspeakers omitting loud white noise, 3rd July
item.description:
Loudspeakers are broadcasting white noise in both ends of the carpark (one towards Bellegrove Road) and another by the entrance of the car park (marked by yellow marker on map). This continues all day long. It is now more prominent with windows open due to hot weather.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bellegrove Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside Nisa, 3rd July
item.description:
The new cycle lane from Agar Grove to St Augustine’s/Murray St doesn’t have any markings do drivers turning from Agar Grove keep mistaking it for the road and driving over/along it!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St. Augustine's Road, Kentish Town, London
